posts.post_content:
Alright, I want confirmation about one thing that my friends keep arguing with me about.  
  
I purposefully tap out my mana with this guy out on the field. I get attacked, and I blocked with my Elf.  
  
Before the combat damage phase, I tap it to get the one mana necessary to [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) my elf.  
  
They say that I can't do that because being tapped removes it from combat, because tapped creatures can't block. I have told them many times that I don't believe this is the case, but this knowledge is so ubiquitous among my friends that I can't argue with them without proof. Can anyone verify this for me?  
  
I'd appreciate it.
posts.html:
Alright, I want confirmation about one thing that my friends keep arguing with me about.

I purposefully tap out my mana with this guy out on the field. I get attacked, and I blocked with my Elf.

Before the combat damage phase, I tap it to get the one mana necessary to Giant Growth my elf.

They say that I can't do that because being tapped removes it from combat, because tapped creatures can't block. I have told them many times that I don't believe this is the case, but this knowledge is so ubiquitous among my friends that I can't argue with them without proof. Can anyone verify this for me?

I'd appreciate it.

posts.post_content:
@Deadhandlord7777  
  
Um, no. Blocking does not cause creatures to tap. Never has. Attacking does unless the creature has vigilance. When you block, you can totally tap the blocking creature to use an activated ability.
posts.html:
@Deadhandlord7777

Um, no. Blocking does not cause creatures to tap. Never has. Attacking does unless the creature has vigilance. When you block, you can totally tap the blocking creature to use an activated ability.

posts.post_content:
Guys, normally people are filled with nostalgia about this card because they've used it so much.  
I feel nostalgia about this cards because a lot of guys who used to be in my playgroup always played with this card.  
We were mostly timmies back in the old days (some 8 years ago). Most of us had this and it even became VERY predictable as to what the guy's gonna do on T1.  
-  
Me : Plains, go. What deck are you playing with by the way?  
Friend : My green/white deck. Forest and I play--  
Me : [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves), what a surprise.  
The game starts with smiles on our faces because of this card.
posts.html:

-

Friend : My green/white deck. Forest and I play--
Me : Llanowar Elves, what a surprise.
The game starts with smiles on our faces because of this card.
